content:
Yes, you used proper punctuation in your sentence with the word "considered". Specifically, you used a question mark at the end of the sentence to indicate that you were asking a question.

The sentence, "Is that considered a 'smart quote'?" is a grammatically correct interrogative sentence. It has a subject ("that"), a linking verb ("considered"), and a predicate adjective ("smart quote"). The question mark at the end of the sentence is used to indicate that the sentence is a question, and it helps convey the tone of inquiry. Overall, the sentence is properly punctuated and grammatically correct.
